bibl.title: William H. Geary and William Williams v. United States of America. Return to Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Writ of Habeas Corpus for William H. Geary + William Williams
Reviewed within for Circuit 3rd Jud District W.T. holding terms at Port Townsend on Friday May 9/73 12.m
Answered same by bringing in Monday May 12/73 William H. Geary + William Williams
Return to Writ of Habeas Corpus
United States v. William H. Geary and William Williams } Committed for mutiny

I do hereby return to Hon. O Jacobs Chief of Justice of W.T. and judge of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory that before the county to me of the accompanny writ the said William H Geary and William Williams are committed to my charge and is detained by virtue of another writ issued by John E. Burns U.S. Commissioner on the 21st day of April A.D. 1873. A copy of which is here to annexed the original of which & who herewith produce nevertheless I have the bodies of the said William H. Geary and William Williams before you on the day and place within mentioned
Subscribed and sworn to J.J.H. VanBokkelen before methis 12 1873 Sheriff of Jefferson County W.T. James Seavey Clerk and Deputy U.S. Marshall of W.T.
United States vs William H. Geary + William Williams Mutiny on board the American Barque Cambridge

To the United States Marshall In the name of the United States you are hereby commanded to keep securely in Prison "William H. Geary and William Williams" until the next term of the U.S. District Court to be held in November next and have then and there (and while discharged by the process of law) to answer to before such court upon the charge of mutiny on board the Barque Cambridge each or either may be released upon proper bail each in $3000.00 with approved surity
also to have captain James Doyle of said Barque Cambridge and E. M. Harrison and John Matthew (seamen) then and there as witnesses on the part of the United States (their bail to be approved) to be
John E Burns U.S. Commissioner 3d Jud District W.T.
United States vs William H Geary and William Williams
Sheriff return to Writ of Habeas Corpus
